page.title: 20Law and Order
page.content: Its many years since Hemingbrough or Cliffe had a village Bobby of their own. The police presence with the notable exception of the 1984 Miners' strike is minimal. The character of the area has long been peaceful and law-abiding. The police service is characterised by P.C. John Nichols of Barlby (8 km distant)."Big John" as he is affectionately known serves as Community Policeman and schools' liaison officer often helping with such matters as road safety and cycle training. The area is expanding with further development planned for the next decade and residents fear that the erstwhile tranquility of the area will become a thing of the past. To date the assimilation of newcomers has gone well.It is hoped this will continue in years to come.
